member.name: M:PayPal.EnumHelper.GetAttributeOfType``1(System.Enum)
member.summary: Gets an attribute on an enum field value.
member.typeparam: The type of the attribute you want to retrieve.
member.param: The enum value.
member.returns: The attribute of type TAttribute that exists on the enumValue declaration.

member.name: M:PayPal.EnumHelper.GetAttributeOfType``2(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an attribute on an enum field value, using a lamda expression. This is useful, when multiple fileds of the have the same value.
member.typeparam: The type of the attribute you want to retrieve.
member.param: The enum value.
member.returns: The attribute of type TAttribute that exists on the enumValue declaration.

member.name: T:PayPal.NameValueAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to indicate the properties that can be converted from and into a NameValueCollection.

member.name: P:PayPal.NameValueAttribute.Name
member.summary: Name of the name-value pair. You can use the KeyOrIndexName of the current object if it is an item of a collection. The KeyOrIndexName is designed by the parent.

member.name: P:PayPal.NameValueAttribute.ValueFormat
member.summary: Format used to convert the value.

member.name: P:PayPal.NameValueAttribute.NameRegex
member.summary: Regex used to recognize names that must be loaded in this property. The regex must contain a capture, if KeyOrIndexName has been specified, with the same name.

member.name: P:PayPal.NameValueAttribute.KeyOrIndexName
member.summary: Used to indicate that the property is a list of items or a dictionary, and to assign a name used to refer to the current element index or key. Each element must be iterated, and child properties saved to the name-value collection.

member.name: P:PayPal.NameValueAttribute.CollectionElementType
member.summary: Indicates the type of the element that should be created for this collection. If it is left null, then the default element type for that collection will be created, if it can be created.

member.name: P:PayPal.NameValueAttribute.CollectionKeyType
member.summary: Indicates a type (primitive or string) to be used as key of this dictionary. If it is left null, then the default element type for that dictionary will be used.

member.name: P:PayPal.NameValueAttribute.Default
member.summary: Default value of property. A missing value when reading, will not touch the property in the object, so it must come initialized with the default value already. When writing, the behavior deppends on WriteDefault property of this attribute, it is used to decide if the property containing a default value should be written or not.

member.name: P:PayPal.NameValueAttribute.WriteDefault
member.summary: Writes the default value, when saving a name-value collection. This does not affect reading, an empty value is converted to the default value. Atention: If the Default value is Empty, and EmptyIgnore is true, then nothing will be written even if WriteDefault is true. [Default is false]

member.name: P:PayPal.NameValueAttribute.EmptyIgnore
member.summary: Indicates whether empty values in the NameValueCollection should be ignored or not. When they are ignored, it is the same as if they were missing, assuming the DefaultValue. In this case, if WriteDefault is true, the default will be written, unless the default is itself an empty value. [Default is true]

member.name: P:PayPal.NameValueAttribute.SaveOrder
member.summary: Tells the order in which this property must be saved. Negative values come first. [Default is 0]

member.name: T:PayPal.TypeDecisionAttribute
member.summary: When a property is of an abstract type, it must be decided what derived class will be created to fill that property. Note that the property must be null, for a decision, otherwise the already existing object will be used.

member.name: M:PayPal.TypeDecisionAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Type)
member.summary: Indicates a type decision, to be made either for the PropertyType or the CollectionElementType. If the type inherits from PropertyType, it will be used for the property. If the type inherits from CollectionElementType, it will be used for the element of the collection.
member.param: Attributes are not compiled in order, so this will be used to sort multiple TypeDecisionAttributes.

member.name: M:PayPal.TypeDecisionAttribute.Decide(PayPal.NvcConversionContex,System.Object)
member.summary: Decides whether the type is to be used or not, based on the passed NameValueCollection.
member.param: Context containing the NameValueCollection to analyse.
member.returns: True to use the type indicated in this attribute; otherwise False.

member.name: P:PayPal.TypeDecisionAttribute.EvaluationIndex
member.summary: Attributes are not compiled in order, so this will be used to sort multiple TypeDecisionAttributes.

member.name: P:PayPal.TypeDecisionAttribute.Type
member.summary: Type to be used when the Decide method returns true.

member.name: T:PayPal.TypeDecisionDefaultAttribute
member.summary: Makes the final type decision, when all other attributes have failed to provide a decision. Note that attributes are evaluated in declaration order, so this one must be the last type decision attribute. Note that the property must be null, for a decision, otherwise the already existing object will be used.

member.name: T:PayPal.TypeDecisionByNameAttribute
member.summary: Decides on a type based on whether a given name is found in the NameValueCollection. Note that the property must be null, for a decision, otherwise the already existing object will be used.

member.name: P:PayPal.TypeDecisionByNameAttribute.NameToFind
member.summary: Indicates a type decision based on the name of an item in the name value collection. If that name is found, the type indicated in this attribute is used.

member.name: T:PayPal.NvcConversionContex
member.summary: Context object used in the conversion process between a NameValueCollection and an arbitrary object. This object must be disposed after using it in a conversion to ensure the conversion is terminated.

member.name: M:PayPal.NvcConversionContex.Dispose
member.summary: Terminates the usage of this context, executing all pending operations.

member.name: P:PayPal.NvcConversionContex.Nvc
member.summary: NameValueCollection that is being loaded or saved.

member.name: P:PayPal.NvcConversionContex.KeyOrIndexValues
member.summary: Dictionary containing the values fo key/index to be replaced in the name of the item.

member.name: P:PayPal.NvcConversionContex.FinalValidations
member.summary: Validations that will be executed after everything is done.

member.name: T:PayPal.INameValueConverter
member.summary: Represents an object that can save/load properties of a target object into/from a NameValueCollection.

member.name: M:PayPal.INameValueConverter.SaveProperty(PayPal.NvcConversionContex,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.String,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Saves a property of the object into the NameValueCollection.
member.param: Provides overall information about the saving process.
An empty NameValueCollection to insert the values into.
Name of the entry in the NameValueCollection.
Object that is to be converted to string, and then inserted into the NameValueCollection.
Format that is to be used in the conversion from object to string.
member.returns: Returns true when the passed value is a simple value, or false, when it is a complex object.

member.name: M:PayPal.INameValueConverter.LoadProperty(PayPal.NvcConversionContex,System.Object,PayPal.NameValueProperty,System.String,System.String,System.Action@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Creates an object to set to a property of the target object, or to insert into a collection of the target object.
member.param: Provides the NameValueCollection that is being used to load the object.
Target object containing the property.
The property that is to be set.
If we want to insert an object into the collection, we must provide a key/index.
String representing the value to be set, or inserted into the collection.
Rollback action, that can be executed to undo everything this method did.
Value that was set to the property, or inserted into the collection.
member.returns: Returns true when the inserted value a simple object, or false, when it is a complex object.

Target object that contains the property being loaded.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PaypalOperation.ApiVersion
member.summary: The version of the Api that this object is to be used with.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PaypalOperation.Values
member.summary: Stores the values saved/loaded during the last save or load operation.

member.name: T:PayPal.Version940.PayPalResult
member.summary: Common Response Fields from a PayPal API call.

remarks.p: The PayPal API always returns common fields in addition to fields that are specific to the requested PayPal API operation.
If the ACK value is not Success, API response fields may not be returned. An error response has the following general format.
Additional pass-through information may appear in the L_ERRORPARAMIDn and L_ERRORPARAMVALUEn fields.

You should log basic information from the request and response messages of each PayPal API operation you execute. You must log the Correlation ID from the response message, which identifies the API operation to PayPal and which must be provided to Merchant Technical Support if you need their assistance with a specific transaction.

All responses to PayPal API operations contain information that may be useful for debugging purposes. In addition to logging the Correlation ID from the response message, you can log other information, such as the transaction ID and timestamp, to enable you to review a transaction on the PayPal website or through the API. You could implement a scheme that logs the entire request and response in a “verbose” mode; however, you should never log the password from a request.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalResult.Status
member.summary: Acknowledgement status.
member.remarks: Acknowledgement status, which is one of the following values: - Success indicates a successful operation. - SuccessWithWarning indicates a successful operation; however, there are messages returned in the response that you should examine. - Failure indicates the operation failed; the response also contains one or more error messages explaining the failure. - FailureWithWarning indicates that the operation failed and that there are messages returned in the response that you should examine.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalResult.CorrelationID
member.summary: Correlation ID, which uniquely identifies the transaction to PayPal.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalResult.TimeStamp
member.summary: The date and time that the requested API operation was performed.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalResult.Version
member.summary: The version of the API.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalResult.Build
member.summary: The sub-version of the API.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalResult.Errors
member.summary: Errors or warnings.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalResult.Values
member.summary: Stores the values saved/loaded during the last save or load operation.

member.name: T:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentShippingInfo
member.summary: Shipping information to send to PayPal, for each payment.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentShippingInfo.ShipToName
member.summary: Person’s name associated with this shipping address.

remarks.p: Person’s name associated with this shipping address. It is required if using a shipping address. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive.
Character length and limitations: 32 single-byte characters
SHIPTONAME is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_SHIPTONAME instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequestBase.Parent
member.summary: The object to which this list is attatched to.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information to send to PayPal.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.Action
member.summary: How you want to obtain payment.

remarks.p: How you want to obtain payment. When implementing parallel payments, this field is required and must be set to Order. When implementing digital goods, this field is required and must be set to Sale. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive; except for digital goods, which supports single payments only. If the transaction does not include a one-time purchase, this field is ignored. It is one of the following values:

li.p: Sale – This is a final sale for which you are requesting payment (default).
Authorization – This payment is a basic authorization subject to settlement with PayPal Authorization and Capture.
Order – This payment is an order authorization subject to settlement with PayPal Authorization and Capture.

div.p: You cannot set this field to Sale in SetExpressCheckout request and then change the value to Authorization or Order in the DoExpressCheckoutPayment request. If you set the field to Authorization or Order in SetExpressCheckout, you may set the field to Sale.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: Up to 13 single-byte alphabetic characters
PAYMENTACTION is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_PAYMENTACTION instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.Amount
member.summary: Total cost of the transaction to the buyer.

remarks.p: (Required) Total cost of the transaction to the buyer. If shipping cost and tax charges are known, include them in this value. If not, this value should be the current sub-total of the order. If the transaction includes one or more one-time purchases, this field must be equal to the sum of the purchases. Set this field to 0 if the transaction does not include a one-time purchase such as when you set up a billing agreement for a recurring payment that is not immediately charged. When the field is set to 0, purchase-specific fields are ignored. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive; except for digital goods, which supports single payments only.

Character length and limitations: Value is a positive number which cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. It includes no currency symbol. It must have 2 decimal places, the decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
AMT is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_AMT instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.CurrencyCode
member.summary: A 3-character currency code (default is USD).

remarks.p: (Optional) A 3-character currency code (default is USD). You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive; except for digital goods, which supports single payments only.
CURRENCYCODE is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_CURRENCYCODE instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.Custom
member.summary: A free-form field for your own use.

remarks.p: (Optional) A free-form field for your own use. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive.

div.p: The value you specify is available only if the transaction includes a purchase. This field is ignored if you set up a billing agreement for a recurring payment that is not immediately charged.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: 256 single-byte alphanumeric characters
CUSTOM is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_CUSTOM instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.Description
member.summary: Description of items the buyer is purchasing.

remarks.p: (Optional) Description of items the buyer is purchasing. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive; except for digital goods, which supports single payments only.

div.p: The value you specify is available only if the transaction includes a purchase. This field is ignored if you set up a billing agreement for a recurring payment that is not immediately charged.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters
DESC is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_DESC instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.InvoiceNum
member.summary: Your own invoice or tracking number.

remarks.p: (Optional) Your own invoice or tracking number. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive; except for digital goods, which supports single payments only.

div.p: The value you specify is available only if the transaction includes a purchase. This field is ignored if you set up a billing agreement for a recurring payment that is not immediately charged.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: 256 single-byte alphanumeric characters
INVNUM is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_INVNUM instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.ItemAmount
member.summary: Sum of cost of all items in this order. A value can be set only when Items collection is empty.

div.p: PAYMENTREQUEST_n_ITEMAMT is required if you specify L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_AMTm.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: Value is a positive number which cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. It includes no currency symbol. It must have 2 decimal places, the decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
ITEMAMT is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_ITEMAMT instead.
remarks.masb: I have seen this being used without specifying any items. That is why this value can be set when there is no element in Items list.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.NotifyUrl
member.summary: Your URL for receiving Instant Payment Notification (IPN) about this transaction.

remarks.p: (Optional) Your URL for receiving Instant Payment Notification (IPN) about this transaction. If you do not specify this value in the request, the notification URL from your Merchant Profile is used, if one exists.You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive; except for digital goods, which supports single payments only.

div.p: The notify URL applies only to DoExpressCheckoutPayment. This value is ignored when set in SetExpressCheckout or GetExpressCheckoutDetails.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: 2,048 single-byte alphanumeric characters
NOTIFYURL is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_NOTIFYURL instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.ShippingDiscountAmount
member.summary: Shipping discount for this order, specified as a negative number.

remarks.p: (Optional) Shipping discount for this order, specified as a negative number. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive.

Character length and limitations: Value is a positive number which cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. It includes no currency symbol. It must have 2 decimal places, the decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
SHIPPINGDISCAMT is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_SHIPPINGDISCAMT instead.

masb.p: I have seen this being sent to PayPal with a '-' sign before the number, in a number of places: link link The statement "Value is a positive number which ..." appears to be false.
Also, this seems to affect the total amount, negatively.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.TaxAmount
member.summary: Sum of tax for all items in this order.

remarks.p: (Optional) Sum of tax for all items in this order. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive; except for digital goods, which supports single payments only.

div.p: PAYMENTREQUEST_n_TAXAMT is required if you specify L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_TAXAMTm

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: Value is a positive number which cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. It includes no currency symbol. It must have 2 decimal places, the decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
TAXAMT is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_TAXAMT instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.BillingType
member.summary: Type of billing agreement.

remarks.p: (Required) Type of billing agreement. For recurring payments, this field must be set to RecurringPayments. In this case, you can specify up to ten billing agreements. Other defined values are not valid.
Type of billing agreement for reference transactions. You must have permission from PayPal to use this field. This field must be set to one of the following values:

li.p: MerchantInitiatedBilling - PayPal creates a billing agreement for each transaction associated with buyer. You must specify version 54.0 or higher to use this option.

MerchantInitiatedBillingSingleAgreement - PayPal creates a single billing agreement for all transactions associated with buyer. Use this value unless you need per-transaction billing agreements. You must specify version 58.0 or higher to use this option.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.BillingAgreementDescription
member.summary: Description of goods or services associated with the billing agreement.

remarks.p: Description of goods or services associated with the billing agreement. This field is required for each recurring payment billing agreement. PayPal recommends that the description contain a brief summary of the billing agreement terms and conditions. For example, buyer is billed at “9.99 per month for 2 years”.
Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequest.PlannedAmount
member.summary: Hint property to calculate the MaximumAmount, when setting up a billing agreement for a recurring payment, or a non immediately charged payment.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequestItem.Parent
member.summary: The object to which this list is attatched to.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequestItem.Description
member.summary: Item description.

remarks.p: (Optional) Item description. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive, and m specifies the list item within the payment; except for digital goods, which supports single payments only. These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_DESC0, L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_DESC1).
Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte characters
This field is introduced in version 53.0. L_DESCn is deprecated since version 63.0. Use L_PAYMENTREQUEST_0_DESCm instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequestItem.Name
member.summary: Item name.

remarks.p: Item name. This field is required when L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_ITEMCATEGORYm is passed. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive, and m specifies the list item within the payment; except for digital goods, which supports single payments only. These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_NAME0, L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_NAME1).
Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte characters
This field is introduced in version 53.0. L_NAMEn is deprecated since version 63.0. Use L_PAYMENTREQUEST_0_NAMEm instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequestItem.Quantity
member.summary: Item quantity.

remarks.p: Item quantity. This field is required when L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_ITEMCATEGORYm is passed. For digital goods (L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_ITEMCATEGORYm=Digital), this field is required. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive, and m specifies the list item within the payment; except for digital goods, which only supports single payments. These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_QTY0, L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_QTY1).
Character length and limitations: Any positive integer
This field is introduced in version 53.0. L_QTYn is deprecated since version 63.0. Use L_PAYMENTREQUEST_0_QTYm instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequestItem.TaxAmount
member.summary: Item sales tax.

remarks.p: (Optional) Item sales tax. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive, and m specifies the list item within the payment; except for digital goods, which only supports single payments. These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_TAXAMT0, L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_TAXAMT1).

Character length and limitations: Value is a positive number which cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. It includes no currency symbol. It must have 2 decimal places, the decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).
L_TAXAMTn is deprecated since version 63.0. Use L_PAYMENTREQUEST_0_TAXAMTm instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPaymentRequestItem.Category
member.summary: Indicates whether an item is digital or physical.

remarks.p: Indicates whether an item is digital or physical. For digital goods, this field is required and must be set to Digital. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive, and m specifies the list item within the payment; except for digital goods, which only supports single payments. These parameters must be ordered sequentially beginning with 0 (for example L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_ITEMCATEGORY0, L_PAYMENTREQUEST_n_ITEMCATEGORY1). It is one of the following values:
This field is available since version 65.1.

member.name: T:PayPal.Version940.PayPalShippingOptions
member.summary: Shipping options to send to PayPal.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalShippingOptions.Parent
member.summary: The object to which this list is attatched to.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalShippingOptions.NoShipping
member.summary: Determines whether or not PayPal displays shipping address fields on the PayPal pages.

remarks.p: Determines whether or not PayPal displays shipping address fields on the PayPal pages. For digital goods, this field is required, and you must set it to 1. It is one of the following values:

li.p: 0 – PayPal displays the shipping address on the PayPal pages.
1 – PayPal does not display shipping address fields whatsoever.
2 – If you do not pass the shipping address, PayPal obtains it from the buyer’s account profile.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: 4 single-byte numeric characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalShippingOptions.AddressOverride
member.summary: Determines whether or not the PayPal pages should display the shipping address set by you.

remarks.p: (Optional) Determines whether or not the PayPal pages should display the shipping address set by you in this SetExpressCheckout request, not the shipping address on file with PayPal for this buyer. Displaying the PayPal street address on file does not allow the buyer to edit that address. It is one of the following values:

li.p: 0 – The PayPal pages should not display the shipping address.
1 – The PayPal pages should display the shipping address.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: 1 single-byte numeric character

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalShippingOptions.RequireConfirmShipping
member.summary: Indicates whether or not you require the buyer’s shipping address be a confirmed address.

remarks.p: Indicates whether or not you require the buyer’s shipping address on file with PayPal be a confirmed address. For digital goods, this field is required, and you must set it to 0. It is one of the following values:

li.p: 0 – You do not require the buyer’s shipping address be a confirmed address.
1 – You require the buyer’s shipping address be a confirmed address.

div.p: Setting this field overrides the setting you specified in your Merchant Account Profile.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: 1 single-byte numeric character

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalShippingOptions.ShippingAddressOverride
member.summary: Same as AddressOverride.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalShippingOptions.RequireConfirmedAddress
member.summary: True when RequireConfirmShipping and not AddressOverride.

member.name: T:PayPal.Version940.PayPalExpressCheckoutOperation
member.summary: Common base class for PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation and PayPalDoExpressCheckoutPaymentOperation classes.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalExpressCheckoutOperation.DefaultCurrencyCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the default currency used for this ExpressCheckout operation. Any payment request that is inserted with an undefined CurrencyCode, will assume that the value is using this default currency.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalExpressCheckoutOperation.AggregatedCurrencyCode
member.summary: Gets or sets an aggregated value of all the payment currencies. When multiple currencies are in use, then this returns CurrencyCode.Undefined. If a single currency is in use, it returns that currency. Setting this property changes all the currencies to a single one.

member.name: M:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.DefaultMaximumAmount(PayPal.Version940.PayPalExpressCheckoutOperation)
member.summary: Gets the default value for the MaximumAmount property, to be used by the NameValueConverter.
member.param: Instance to calculate the default MaximumAmount property for.
member.returns: The default MaximumAmount property for the instance.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.Method
member.summary: Method name: SetExpressCheckout.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.MaximumAmount
member.summary: The expected maximum total amount of the complete order, including shipping cost and tax charges.

remarks.p: (Optional) The expected maximum total amount of the complete order, including shipping cost and tax charges. If the transaction includes one or more one-time purchases, this field is ignored.
For recurring payments, you should pass the expected average transaction amount (default 25.00). PayPal uses this value to validate the buyer’s funding source.

Character length and limitations: Value is a positive number which cannot exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. It includes no currency symbol. It must have 2 decimal places, the decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

div.p: This field is required when implementing the Instant Update API callback. PayPal recommends that the maximum total amount be slightly greater than the sum of the line-item order details, tax, and the shipping options of greatest value.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.AllowNote
member.summary: Allows the user to leave a note.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.BuyerEmailOptinEnable
member.summary: Allows user to enter e-mail for additional contact (promotions, etc.)

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.Callback
member.summary: (Optional) URL to which the callback request from PayPal is sent. It must start with HTTPS for production integration. It can start with HTTPS or HTTP for sandbox testing. Character length and limitations: 1024 single-byte characters This field is available since version 53.0.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.CallbackVersion
member.summary: Version of the callback API. This field is required when implementing the Instant Update Callback API. It must be set to 61.0 or a later version. This field is available since version 61.0.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.ReturnURL
member.summary: URL to which the buyer’s browser is returned after choosing to pay with PayPal.

remarks.p: (Required) URL to which the buyer’s browser is returned after choosing to pay with PayPal. For digital goods, you must add JavaScript to this page to close the in-context experience.

div.p: PayPal recommends that the value be the final review page on which the buyer confirms the order and payment or billing agreement.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: 2048 single-byte characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.CancelURL
member.summary: URL to which the buyer is returned if the buyer does not approve the use of PayPal to pay you.

remarks.p: (Required) URL to which the buyer is returned if the buyer does not approve the use of PayPal to pay you. For digital goods, you must add JavaScript to this page to close the in-context experience.

div.p: PayPal recommends that the value be the original page on which the buyer chose to pay with PayPal or establish a billing agreement.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: 2048 single-byte characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.BankPendingUrl
member.summary: (Optional) The URL on the merchant site to transfer to after a bank transfer payment. NOTE:Use this field only if you are using giropay or bank transfer payment methods in Germany.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutOperation.BrandName
member.summary: (Optional) A label that overrides the business name in the PayPal account on the PayPal hosted checkout pages. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSetExpressCheckoutResult.Token
member.summary: A timestamped token by which you identify to PayPal that you are processing this payment with Express Checkout.

remarks.p: A timestamped token by which you identify to PayPal that you are processing this payment with Express Checkout. The token expires after three hours. If you set the token in the SetExpressCheckout request, the value of the token in the response is identical to the value in the request. Character length and limitations: 20 single-byte characters

member.name: T:PayPal.Version940.PayPalExpressCheckoutConfirmation
member.summary: Incoming model from PayPal when the user confirms an ExpressCheckout operation, and is returned back to the original site.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalDoExpressCheckoutPaymentOperation.Token
member.summary: The timestamped token value that was returned in the SetExpressCheckout response and passed in the GetExpressCheckoutDetails request.

remarks.p: (Required) The timestamped token value that was returned in the SetExpressCheckout response and passed in the GetExpressCheckoutDetails request.
Character length and limitations: 20 single-byte characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalDoExpressCheckoutPaymentOperation.PayerId
member.summary: Unique PayPal buyer account identification number as returned in the GetExpressCheckoutDetails response.

remarks.p: (Required) Unique PayPal buyer account identification number as returned in the GetExpressCheckoutDetails response.
Character length and limitations: 13 single-byte alphanumeric characters

member.name: T:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSubscriberShippingAddress
member.summary: Shipping information to send to PayPal for the subscription.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalSubscriberShippingAddress.Name
member.summary: Person’s name associated with this shipping address.

remarks.p: Person’s name associated with this shipping address. It is required if using a shipping address. You can specify up to 10 payments, where n is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive.
Character length and limitations: 32 single-byte characters
SHIPTONAME is deprecated since version 63.0. Use PAYMENTREQUEST_0_SHIPTONAME instead.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPersonName.Salutation
member.summary: Buyer’s salutation.

remarks.p: (Optional) Buyer’s salutation.
Character length and limitations: 20 single-byte characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPersonName.FirstName
member.summary: Buyer’s first name.

remarks.p: (Optional) Buyer’s first name.
Character length and limitations: 25 single-byte characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPersonName.MiddleName
member.summary: Buyer’s middle name.

remarks.p: (Optional) Buyer’s middle name.
Character length and limitations: 25 single-byte characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPersonName.LastName
member.summary: Buyer’s last name.

remarks.p: (Optional) Buyer’s last name.
Character length and limitations: 25 single-byte characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPersonName.Suffix
member.summary: Buyer’s suffix.

remarks.p: (Optional) Buyer’s suffix.
Character length and limitations: 12 single-byte characters

member.name: T:PayPal.Version940.PayPalPayerAddress
member.summary: Address of the payer.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalScheduleDetails.Description
member.summary: Description of the recurring payment.

remarks.p: (Required) Description of the recurring payment.

div.p: You must ensure that this field matches the corresponding billing agreement description included in the SetExpressCheckout request.

remarks.p: Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalScheduleDetails.MaxFailedPayments
member.summary: Number of scheduled payments that can fail before the profile is automatically suspended.

remarks.p: (Optional) Number of scheduled payments that can fail before the profile is automatically suspended. An IPN message is sent to the merchant when the specified number of failed payments is reached.
Character length and limitations: Number string representing an integer

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalScheduleDetails.AutoBillOutstandingAmount
member.summary: Indicates whether you would like PayPal to automatically bill the outstanding balance amount in the next billing cycle.

remarks.p: (Optional) Indicates whether you would like PayPal to automatically bill the outstanding balance amount in the next billing cycle. The outstanding balance is the total amount of any previously failed scheduled payments that have yet to be successfully paid. It is one of the following values:

li.p: NoAutoBill – PayPal does not automatically bill the outstanding balance.
AddToNextBilling – PayPal automatically bills the outstanding balance.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalRecurringPaymentsProfileDetails.SubscriberName
member.summary: Full name of the person receiving the product or service paid for by the recurring payment.

remarks.p: (Optional) Full name of the person receiving the product or service paid for by the recurring payment. If not present, the name in the buyer’s PayPal account is used.
Character length and limitations: 32 single-byte characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalRecurringPaymentsProfileDetails.BillingStartDate
member.summary: The date when billing for this profile begins.

remarks.p: (Required) The date when billing for this profile begins.
NOTE:The profile may take up to 24 hours for activation.
Character length and limitations: Must be a valid date, in UTC/GMT format.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalRecurringPaymentsProfileDetails.ProfileReference
member.summary: The merchant’s own unique reference or invoice number.

remarks.p: (Optional) The merchant’s own unique reference or invoice number.
Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalCreateRecurringPaymentsProfileOperation.Token
member.summary: A timestamped token, the value of which was returned in the response to the first call to SetExpressCheckout.

remarks.p: A timestamped token, the value of which was returned in the response to the first call to SetExpressCheckout. You can also use the token returned in the SetCustomerBillingAgreement response. Either this token or a credit card number is required. If you include both token and credit card number, the token is used and credit card number is ignored Call CreateRecurringPaymentsProfile once for each billing agreement included in SetExpressCheckout request and use the same token for each call. Each CreateRecurringPaymentsProfile request creates a single recurring payments profile.
NOTE:Tokens expire after approximately 3 hours.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalCreateRecurringPaymentsProfileResult.ProfileId
member.summary: An unique identifier for future reference to the details of this recurring payment.

remarks.p: An unique identifier for future reference to the details of this recurring payment.
Character length and limitations: Up to 14 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalCreateRecurringPaymentsProfileResult.ProfileStatus
member.summary: Status of the recurring payment profile.

remarks.p: Status of the recurring payment profile.

li.p: ActiveProfile – The recurring payment profile has been successfully created and activated for scheduled payments according the billing instructions from the recurring payments profile.
PendingProfile – The system is in the process of creating the recurring payment profile. Please check your IPN messages for an update.

member.name: P:PayPal.Version940.PayPalApi.EndPoints
member.summary: Sets up the end-point URL's used to make requests.

member.name: F:PayPal.Version940.ApiProtocol.NVP
member.summary: Name value pair HTTP/HTTPS POST based protocol.

member.name: F:PayPal.Version940.ApiProtocol.SOAP
member.summary: Simple Object Access Protocol.

member.name: F:PayPal.Version940.ApiCredentialType.Signature
member.summary: Credential that is verified by a signature sent over HTTPS protocol.

member.name: F:PayPal.Version940.ApiCredentialType.Certificate
member.summary: Credential that is verified by using a certificate and a private key to encript data.

member.name: F:PayPal.Version940.ApiEnvironmentType.Production
member.summary: Production is the environment where the application work with real money and users.

member.name: F:PayPal.Version940.ApiEnvironmentType.Sandbox
member.summary: Sandbox is a testing environment, where you can test your application using only play-money, and fake users.
